body:
Sarus is an OCI-compliant container engine for HPC systems.

The post-install step requires root privileges. The package issues a warning at the end of spack's installation with the necessary steps to complete the configuration (similar to var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/singularityce/package.py)

tini is a tiny init for containers. It is a dependency of Sarus.

As an alternative to the post-installation message, I was trying to call sudo from within Sarus's package.py on the script mentioned in the post-installation message so as to avoid the chance of a user missing the message. The command ran fine but it didn't accept valid password entries. That is perhaps because spack is processing the input before is handed over to sudo?
title: New package: Sarus
